c3-s93.translation: Ten tens are called a hundred (Paek, 百, 10²).

c3-s94.translation: Ten hundreds are called a thousand (Tshen, 千, 10³).

c3-s95.translation: Ten thousands are called a myriad (Muonh, 萬, 10⁴).

c3-s96.translation: Ten myriad (one hundred thousand, Djip muonh, 十萬, 10⁵).

c3-s97.translation: Hundred myriad (one million, Paek muonh, 百萬, 10⁶).

c3-s98.translation: Thousand myriad (ten million, Tshen muonh, 千萬, 10⁷).

c3-s99.translation: A myriad myriad (one hundred million) are called Qyk (億, 10⁸).

c3-s100.translation: A myriad Qyk (a trillion) are called Driewq (兆, 10¹²).

c3-s101.translation: A myriad Driewq (ten quadrillion) are called Kyaeng (京, 10¹⁶).

c3-s102.translation: A myriad Kyaeng (a hundred quintillion) are called Koej (垓, 10²°).

c3-s103.translation: A myriad Koej (one septillion) are called Tsiq (秭, 10²⁴).

c3-s104.translation: A myriad Tsiq (ten octillion) are called Njyangq (壤, 10²⁸).

c3-s105.translation: A myriad Njyangq (one hundred nonillion) are called Kou (溝, 10³²).

c3-s106.translation: A myriad Kou (one undecillion) are called Kaenh (澗, 10³⁶).

c3-s107.translation: A myriad Kaenh (ten duodecillion) are called Tjiaengh (正, 10⁴°).

c3-s108.translation: A myriad Tjiaengh (a hundred tredecillion) are called Tseojq (載, 10⁴⁴)

c3-s112.translation: Ten Mak (one hundred billionth) are called Miewq (渺, 10⁻¹¹).

c3-s113.translation: Ten Miewq (one ten-billionth) are called Qeoj (埃, 10⁻¹⁰).

c3-s114.translation: Ten Qeoj (one billionth) are called Drin (塵, 10⁻⁹).

c3-s115.translation: Ten Drin (one hundred millionth) are called Srae (沙, 10⁻⁸).

c3-s116.translation: Ten Srae (one ten-millionth) are called Siem (纖, 10⁻⁷).

c3-s117.translation: Ten Siem (one millionth) are called Muj (微, 10⁻⁶).

c3-s118.translation: Ten Muj (one hundred thousandth) are called Hot (忽, 10⁻⁵).

c3-s119.translation: Ten Hot (one ten-thousandth) are called Sy (絲, 10⁻⁴).

c3-s120.translation: Ten Sy (one thousandth, milli-) are called Ghaw (毫, 10⁻³).

c3-s121.translation: Ten Ghaw (one hundredth) are called Ly (釐, 10⁻²).

c3-s122.translation: Ten Ly (one tenth) are called Pun (分, 10⁻¹).
